Genetics and Microbiology 37 

$. Auerbach, C. Chemical mutagenesis. Biol. Rev., Cambridge Phil. 
 Soc, 24:355-391, 1949. 

4. Austrian, R. Bacterial transformation reactions. Bad. Rev., 
 16:31-50, 1952. 

5. Barksdale, W. L.. and Pappenheimer, A. M., Jr. Phage-host re- 
 lationships in nontoxigenic and toxigenic diphtheria bacilli. 
 /. Bact, 67:220-232, 1954. 

6. Braun, W. Bacterial dissociation. Bad. Rev., 11:75-114, 1947. 

7. Braun, W. Bacterial Genetics. W. B. Saunders Co., Philadelphia, 
 1953. 

8. Browning, C. H. Chemotherapy in trypanosome infections: an 
 experimental study. /. Path. Bad., 12:166-190, 1908. 

9. Darlington, C. D. Heredity, development and infection. Nature, 
 154:164-169, 1944. 

10. Demerec, M., Bertani, G., and Flint, J. A survey of chemicals for 
 mutagenic action on E. coli. Am. Naturalist, 85:119-136, 1951. 

11. Dubos, R. J. The Bacterial Cell. Harvard University Press, 
 Cambridge, Massachusetts, 1945. 

12. Dubos, R. J. Variations in antigenic properties of bacteria. Cold 
 Spring Harbor Symposia Quant. Biol., 11:60-65, 1946. 

13. Ephrussi, B. Nucleo-cytoplasmic Relations in Microorganisms. 
 Oxford University Press, London, 1953. 

14. Gowen, J. W., and Lincoln, R. E. A test for sexual fusion in 
 bacteria. /. Bad., 44:551-554, 1942. 

15. Green, R. G. Viruses, parasitism and malignant growth. Biody- 
 namica, 2:1-8, 1938. 

16. Griffith, F. The significance of pneumococcal types. /. Hyg., 
 27:113-159, 1928. 

17. Groman, N. B. Evidence for the active role of bacteriophage in 
 the conversion of non-toxigenic Cory neb aderium diphtheriae 
 to toxin production. /. Bact. (in Press). 

18. Hadley, P. Microbic dissociation. /. Infectious Diseases, 40:1-312, 
 1927. 

19. Haldane, J. B. S. In defence of genetics. Modern Quart. (Lon- 
 don), 4:194-202, 1949. 

20. Hotchkiss, R. D., and Marmur, J. Double marker transformations 
 as evidence of linked factors in desoxyribonucleate transforming 
 agents. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U. S., 40:55-60, 1954. 

21. Iseki, S., and Sakai, T. Artificial transformation of O antigens in 
 Salmonella E group. Proc. Japan Acad., 29:121-126; 127-131, 
 1953. 

22. Kelner, A. Effect of visible light on the recovery of Streptomyces 
 griseus conidia from ultraviolet irradiation injury. Proc. Nail. 
 Acad. Sci. U. S., 35:73-79, 1949. 

23. Klein, D. T., and Klein, R. M. Transmittance of tumor-inducing 
 ability to avirulent crown-gall and related bacteria. /. Bad., 
 66:220-228, 1953.
